movies.title: Help Me, My Love
movies.plot: Romantic comedy-drama about a husband (Sordi) who is jealous of his wife's (Vitti) infatuation with a Professor.
movies.simplePlot: Romantic comedy-drama about a husband (Sordi) who is jealous of his wife's (Vitti) infatuation with a Professor.

biography.bio: One of Italy's most captivating and talented cinematic comedy stars, Italian veteran Alberto Sordi was known for satirizing his country's social mores in pungent black comedies, farcical tales and grim drama. He, along with peers Vittorio Gassman, Ugo Tognazzi and Nino Manfredi, arguably represent the finest of post-war Italian cinema history. Born in Rome on June 15, 1920 in the Trastevere district, Sordi grew up in a musical family, his father being a tuba player for the Rome Opera House. A choir boy at the Sistine Chapel, he later trained for the theater in Milan but returned to Rome to work in radio and musical halls in comedy shows. In the late 30s he found his way into film as an extra. His first important role was in The Three Pilots (1942), a fascist war picture, but he wouldn't hit international stardom until a decade later when he starred in Federico Fellini's early films The White Sheik (1952) and I Vitelloni (1953). The titles of some of his most prolific characters were as simple as their titles: The Seducer, The Bachelor, The Husband, The Widower, The Traffic Cop, and The Moralist. Most of his protagonists amusingly, but not always pleasantly, stereotyped the worst attributes of Italian men and society, yet many of his films are unparalleled in quality and considered masterpieces. Sordi went on to star, direct and co-write more than 150 films. Never married and rather an introvert, he enjoyed a quiet, reclusive personal life. On his 80th birthday, he was made Mayor of Rome for the day. In 2002, after 190 films, he announced his retirement, and died of a heart attack the following year at age 82.
biography.name: Alberto Sordi

biography.bio: Monica Vitti was born on November 3, 1931 in Rome, Lazio, Italy as Maria Luisa Ceciarelli. She is an actress, known for L'Avventura (1960), Red Desert (1964) and L'Eclisse (1962). She has been married to Roberto Russo since 1995.
biography.name: Monica Vitti

biography.bio: Silvano Tranquilli was born on August 23, 1925 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He is known for his work on The Pumaman (1980), Les fleurs du soleil (1970) and Black Belly of the Tarantula (1971). He died on May 10, 1997 in Rome.
biography.name: Silvano Tranquilli

biography.bio: Laura Adani was born on October 7, 1913 in Modena, Emilia-Romagna, Italy. She was an actress, known for Borsalino (1970), You're on Your Own (1959) and Gli addii (1961). She was married to Carlo Ernesto Balbo Bertone di Sambuy and Luigi Visconti di Modrone. She died on August 30, 1996 in Mocalieri, Piedmont, Italy.
biography.name: Laura Adani

biography.bio: Ugo Gregoretti was born on September 28, 1930 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He is a director and writer, known for Rogopag (1963), Omicron (1963) and Ah! Les belles familles (1964). He has been married to Fausta Capece Minutolo del Sasso e di san Valentino since April 28, 1964. They have five children.
biography.name: Ugo Gregoretti

biography.bio: Mariolina Cannuli is an actress, known for Help Me, My Love (1969), Mazzabubù... quante corna stanno quaggiù? (1971) and Valentina, una ragazza che ha fretta (1977).
biography.name: Mariolina Cannuli

biography.bio: Maurizio Davini is an actor, known for Help Me, My Love (1969) and La scoperta (1969).
biography.name: Maurizio Davini

biography.bio: Néstor Garay was born on January 13, 1931 in Santa Rosa, Argentina. He was an actor, known for Allegro non troppo (1976), L'imposteur (1982) and È proibito ballare (1989). He died on April 11, 2003 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Néstor Garay

biography.bio: Gaetano Imbró is an actor, known for They Call Me Trinity (1970), A Lizard in a Woman's Skin (1971) and Boot Hill (1969).
biography.name: Gaetano Imbró

biography.bio: Like his Italian-French counterpart Lino Ventura, who had been a wrestler before becoming an actor, Berlin-born Karl-Otto Alberty was an amateur boxer before he turned to acting, making his debut in a Konstanz theater in 1959. For three decades he was to be a regular of German cinema and television as well as of international English-speaking productions. However, unlike Ventura, Alberty did not become a star, remaining confined to supporting roles or even bit parts, most of the time as a German officer, although in widely seen international productions such as The Great Escape (1963), The Damned (1969) or Raid on Rommel (1971). A lookalike of Benito Mussolini (with the exception of his white-blond hair), he would have been an ideal Duce though. A missed opportunity indeed.
biography.name: Karl-Otto Alberty

biography.bio: Liliana Pavlo is an actress, known for The Crimes of the Black Cat (1972), Help Me, My Love (1969) and Night of the Serpent (1969).
biography.name: Liliana Pavlo
